skill.name: docker-workflow
skill.description: Comprehensive Docker containerization workflow covering multi-stage builds, docker-compose orchestration, image optimization, debugging, and production best practices. Use when containerizing applications, setting up development environments, or deploying with Docker.
skill.summary: Comprehensive Docker containerization workflow covering multi-stage builds, docker-compose orchestra...
skill.author: AutumnsGrove

security_audit.summary: Legitimate Docker documentation and container management skill. Static scanner flagged 183 patterns but all are false positives: backticks in markdown (code display), placeholder credentials in templates, and standard Docker operations. No malicious intent, no data exfiltration, no credential exposure. Risk is limited to standard Docker CLI operations for containerized applications.

low_findings.title: Backup function creates directories
low_findings.description: The backup_volumes function creates directories using mkdir -p. This is standard for backup functionality.

content.value_statement: Package applications into portable, reproducible containers for consistent development and deployment. Build optimized images with multi-stage builds, orchestrate multi-container applications, and deploy with confidence.
actual_capabilities: Create optimized Dockerfiles using multi-stage builds
Debug containers with health checks and inspection utilities
Optimize image size through layer caching and best practices
limitations: Requires Docker to be installed on the system
Cannot execute containers directly, requires Docker CLI
Does not manage Kubernetes or container registries

use_cases.title: Standardize deployment pipelines
use_cases.description: Create consistent container images for CI/CD pipelines with security hardening and optimized builds.

use_cases.title: Set up local development
use_cases.description: Configure development environments with hot-reload, volume mounting, and multi-service orchestration.

use_cases.title: Design production infrastructure
use_cases.description: Build production-ready containers with health checks, resource limits, and rolling deployment strategies.

prompt_templates.title: Create a Dockerfile
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a multi-stage Dockerfile for a [language: Node.js, Python, Go, Java] application. Include security best practices, non-root user, and health checks.

prompt_templates.title: Configure services
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a docker-compose.yml for a [application type: full-stack, microservices] with [services: frontend, backend, database, cache]. Include networking, health checks, and environment configuration.

prompt_templates.title: Optimize images
prompt_templates.prompt: Review and optimize this Dockerfile to reduce image size. Suggest multi-stage build improvements, smaller base images, and layer caching strategies.

prompt_templates.title: Debug containers
prompt_templates.prompt: Container [container_name] is [issue: exiting, unhealthy, not responding]. Show commands to diagnose the issue and suggest fixes based on health check and logs.

output_examples.input: Create a Dockerfile for a Node.js Express API with PostgreSQL
output: Multi-stage build with builder and production stages

output_examples.input: Set up docker-compose for a full-stack app with React frontend, Python backend, and Redis cache
output: Frontend service with Next.js production build
Backend service with FastAPI and health checks
Redis service for caching with password

output_examples.input: Optimize this Python Docker image that is currently 900MB
output: Switch from python:3.11 to python:3.11-slim base image (~150MB savings)
Use multi-stage build to separate build dependencies
Combine RUN commands to reduce layers
Add .dockerignore to exclude test files and documentation
Consider alpine variant for additional size reduction

best_practices: Use specific base image versions instead of latest tag for reproducible builds
Run containers as non-root users to limit privilege escalation risks
Implement health checks to enable reliable orchestration and graceful restarts
anti_patterns: Copying entire project directory before installing dependencies (invalidates cache)
Including sensitive files or credentials in the build context
Using latest base image tags without version pinning

faq.question: Which programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: Docker workflows support any language. Templates provided for Node.js, Python, Go, Java, Rust, and general multi-stage builds.

faq.question: What are the image size limits?
faq.answer: Multi-stage builds typically reduce images by 50-90 percent. Node.js alpine images are around 180MB. Go scratch images can be under 15MB.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with Kubernetes?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on Docker and docker-compose. Kubernetes deployment patterns require separate configuration and tools.

faq.question: Is my data safe inside containers?
faq.answer: Data in containers is ephemeral unless persisted with volumes. Use docker volumes for databases. Never store credentials in images.

faq.question: Why is my container exiting immediately?
faq.answer: Common causes: missing CMD/ENTRYPOINT, application crash, port binding issues. Use docker logs and docker inspect to diagnose.

faq.question: How does this compare to container orchestration platforms?
faq.answer: Docker-compose manages local multi-container apps. Orchestration platforms like Kubernetes handle production deployment, scaling, and networking across clusters.
